title.en: Revenge [Complete Edition] + Joya Kagemaru short story collection

altTitles.ja: 復讐記〔完全版〕+影丸穣也短編集

description.en:
Original work by Alexandre Dumas
--"The Count of Monte Cristo"--
Envy, lies, intrigue, betrayal, lamentation, anger, < /span> Full of realism Producing a classic revenge drama!! Ikki Kajiwara & Jōya Kagemaru combination
Grudge, revenge and sadness...!

Joya Kagemaru Simultaneously included short works "The Man Who Came from the Graveyard" and "Giant Mask"!!

Synopsis
Early 19th century, France. With a new position as captain and a beautiful fiancée, young sailor Edmond Dantes is at the peak of happiness. However, he is suddenly accused of something he doesn't remember and is forced into Château d'If, the island of coffins. Dantes, who is experiencing the height of despair, meets Priest Faria, who is passionate about escape from prison and learning, and finds hope in learning. It has been 14 years since he was imprisoned...Dante realized that he had been trapped by his three friends and the prosecutor under the advice of a priest, and he miraculously succeeded in escaping!And he used the knowledge and education that he received from the priest. Armed with gold and silver treasures, he begins to take revenge on the people who drove him to the depths of despair and nightmares!!

Explanation
Edmond Dantes, who was falsely accused of a crime, was in prison, on the edge of despair and nightmares. Having made a miraculous escape from prison and obtained the treasure, Dantes appears in the Parisian society calling himself "The Count of Monte Cristo", vowing to take revenge on those who have captured him!

- A dramatic adaptation of French literary giant Alexandre Dumas's masterpiece, "The Count of Monte Cristo" -
The epic revenge classic was recreated in a manga magazine by Ikki Kajiwara and Jo Kagemaru, who later collaborated on works such as Karate Baka Ichidai and Giant's Samurai Flame. Also. They serialized Melville's "Moby Dick'' in "Weekly Shonen Magazine''
in 1968, and this is their second work to adapt a classic into a graphic novel. Ikki Kajiwara, who uses sports and martial arts as his subject matter to vividly portray the spirit and perseverance of the protagonist Edmond Dantes,
Expressing anger, Joya Kagemaru makes you feel the strength in each frame with a realistic and tense graphic novel... That story is "Revengeki,'' which was serialized in "Weekly Shonen King'' in 1969. This reprint includes Joya Kagemaru's short stories ``The Man Who Came from the Graveyard'' and "Giant Mask.'' This is a work that will move readers' hearts without sacrificing the charm of the original work.
